definition: awe-inspiring/abbr. for 赫茲|赫兹[he4 zi1], hertz (Hz)

sentences.english: Regaining the mantle of England's most decorated champions from Manchester United is imperative.
sentences.chinese: 从曼联手中夺回英国最显赫的锦标，势在必行。

sentences.english: She married into a prominent family.
sentences.chinese: 她嫁到一个显赫的家族。

sentences.english: Many of the pilots were to achieve eminence in the aeronautical world.
sentences.chinese: 这些飞行员中很多人将会在航空界声名显赫。

sentences.english: DE YOU Brand Rotating Hooks will bring you great economic and social benefit.
sentences.chinese: 愿德友牌旋梭为您带来显赫的经济效益和社会效益。

sentences.english: In the early Qing Dynasty, Han Tan's poetry and articles are well known.
sentences.chinese: 韩菼，在清初文名显赫，其诗名亦不落于文后。

sentences.english: The new company you will join is a Telco giant with solid reputation.
sentences.chinese: 你要加盟的新公司是声誉显赫的电信业巨臂。

sentences.english: Sun Jian in with the help of the illustrious military exploits the way troops.
sentences.chinese: 在孙坚的帮助下，这一路部队战功显赫。

sentences.english: Given an audience with President Lincoln, he discoursed at length on the high and ancient nobility of his distinguished family.
sentences.chinese: 他不厌其烦细说自己家世显赫，自古就是高门贵族。

sentences.english: By 1920, Fox and Universal were already names to conjure with.
sentences.chinese: 到1920年，福克斯和环球已经声名显赫。

sentences.english: AS a result of his refusal to obey the chairman.
sentences.chinese: 他因为拒绝服从主席而顿然显赫一时。
如今有钻石珠宝，名声显赫，坐拥豪宅。

sentences.english: He came into prominence as a result of his refusal to obey the chairman.
sentences.chinese: 他因为拒绝服从主席而顿然显赫一时。

sentences.english: As stripped off the post of general-manager, he has lost his noted social status.
sentences.chinese: 他被免去了总经理的职务，失去了显赫的地位。

sentences.english: The club is convinced that the 17-year-old has the potential for a glorious career.
sentences.chinese: 俱乐部深信这位17岁的少年有显赫职业生涯的潜质。

sentences.english: These quondam rulers of China have had a bad reputation abroad.
sentences.chinese: 这些显赫一时的中国统治者们在国外的声誉很坏。

sentences.english: To be sure, modernism had its illustrious intellectual ancestry.
sentences.chinese: 毫无疑问，现代主义有其声名显赫的的智慧祖先。

definition: offspring a famous family (idiom); good breeding/blue blood
variant of 開國元勳|开国元勋, founding figure (of country or dynasty)/founding father/fig. also used of company, school etc
founding figure (of a country or dynasty)/founding father/fig. also used of company or school etc
